column1: Worksheet 3.4: People reporting some evidence of depression or anxiety
Source: Understanding Society, UK Household Longitudinal Study
This worksheet contains two tables. Tables 3.4a and 3.4b are presented vertically with a blank row in between.

Table 3.4a contains percentage estimates for adults in the UK, from January 2009 until December 2021. Table 3.4b contains percentage estimates for the latest period, January 2020 to December 2021, broken down by UK country, English region, age and sex.

This indicator is based on the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) which asks respondents 12 questions about their recent feelings. Once all 12 questions are scored, these scores are added so that each individual has a score which ranges from 0 to 12. A score of four or more has been shown to indicate that the individual has symptoms of mild to moderate illness such as anxiety or depression.
See the Notes worksheet for further guidance. The relevant notes are 1 to 4, 6, 7 and 10.
Some shorthand is used in this table (detailed information can be found in the Cover sheet worksheet).
LCL = lower confidence interval. UCL = upper confidence interval.
Percentage with some evidence indicating depression or anxiety
Percentage with some evidence indicating depression or anxiety, Jan 2020 to Dec 2021 by UK country, English region, age and sex
